reviews.title: Beware of these people
reviews.text: We reserved a room with Elisabetta more than 6 months in advance since sea view rooms on the Cinque Terre are in big demand. The room was confirmed with a credit card. When we arrived at the check on time there was no one there. We had passerbys call her mobile phone and she sent someone to meet us who could hardly speak English. He informed us that they had no room for us. We showed him a copy of her email confirmation to us and then he said wait, called her and then disappeared for almost an hour. He returned to tell us that he had arranged two rooms for us since we would have to switch rooms after the first night. One cost more and one cost less than what we had confirmed and neither had a sea view. Elisabetta never did make a personal appearance. This place was recommended in a very popular guidebook. Beware if you think you are going to have a room when you arrive since we heard that some Cinque Terre operators cancel your reservation when they get a better rate from others.

reviews.title: Beware, resevations are not honored !
reviews.text: I reserved a room for 3 nights from Elisabetta in May for our September stay. We where guaranteed a room with terrace, private bath and ocean view. Two weeks before we arrived she informed me that the ocean view room was only available for 2 of the 3 nights we had reserved and we where to stay at her Mother's house. At this point it was too late to find another place so agreed to this arrangement, 2 nights with the ocean view would be fine.

reviews.title: Good basic accommodation with great views in a great town
reviews.text: After arriving in Vernazza, going up hill to the Mother house, we where sent to the another relatives B&B, up hill again with luggage, put into a room with no window and a shared bath.

reviews.title: Absolutely wonderful stay
reviews.text: The following day our luggage was moved to Elisabetta's, we where put into a room with no view and no terrace.

reviews.title: Wedding in Vernazza
reviews.text: We spoke with a couple from Australia who where staying at Elisabetta's and had the very same experience . Do not trust Elisabetta, reservations mean nothing!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I first used TripAdvisor to help us plan a New England road trip last summer and it did not let us down once. This year, we're off to climb Le Mont Blanc, then have a week in Cinque Terre and Milan. First stop? tripadvisor.com.
reviews.title: Always trust TripAdvisor; never trust Elisabetta Carro.

likes.disliked: — Lack of reliability: if you take a booking, you should honour it.

reviews.text: We saw the photos of Camere Elisabetta and fell in love with it. The reviews on Elisabetta's lack of reliability were too frequent for comfort, however. To our peril, we ignored these reviews and booked 5 nights in Camere Elisabetta - room #3 for €65/night.
reviews.title: amazing location

reviews.text: No sooner had we confirmed our booking when Elisabetta let us down and emailed to say she wouldn't be able to honour it, but could offer another room with no sea view at a reduced rate. With our nerves tipped over the edge, and wishing we had listened to our trusty TripAdvisor in the first instance, we declined this offer.
reviews.title: Fantastic Terrace/Kind Hosts

reviews.text: The only saving grace to this episode is that we found out now, and not when we arrived with our weary legs having summited Mont Blanc. There are two morals to this story: always trust Trip Advisor; and never trust Elisabetta Carro.
reviews.title: Don't count on it

reviews.text: I had read some negative comments about Elisabetta before our departure. This place is not for everyone, it is a long climb, but worth all of the effort. We had no complaints, the rooms were clean and funky, with spectacular views, which is what we wanted. We asked for the 2 rooms that share an incredible roof deck overlooking Vernazza. She was expecting us, met us at the train and we did not see her again until we paid her. Perfect.
reviews.title: lovely stay

likes.liked: — Great value for money, clean, helpful staff
likes.disliked: — noise from the local train station

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a week in Vernazza and wanted accommodation with a view. Camere Elisabetta delivered (as the photos show). Our room with ensuite was located at one of the highest points above the village and was quite a climb, especially if carrying luggage. Elisabetta's husband Joseph, helped us with the heaviest suitcase so make sure you ask for help if booking these rooms.
reviews.title: Amazing location, quirky and memorable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A bonus was the large rooftop terrace with its panoramic view of Vernazza and the coast - what a spot to come home to after a day's walking. You need ask for one of the two rooms that have access to this rooftop terrace.
reviews.title: Basic and good with a fantastic view, in a great village.

likes.disliked: — Had lots of stairs to get to it - could be a problem for others.

reviews.title: We will return!!
reviews.text: Our bedroom window looked south over the water towards Corniglia and the small table beneath it was a wonderful breakfast spot. The room is built into the rock face high above the water, so the only neighbors are seagulls! The sound of the waves lulls you to sleep at night.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Vernazza is a perfect location for exploring the Cinque Terre and Eisabetta Rooms offer modest accommodation in an unforgettable location.
reviews.title: There are better places to stay....

likes.disliked: — the awkwardness of having to walk through the owners living room to use the restroom.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want 5 start treatment this is not the place, nor does it claim to be. It is what is advertised a room in Vernazza at a great rate with the most fantastic sea view. We aren't just talking you can see the ocean, you can just about touch the ocean. From the room we had on Via Carattino, it was simply amazing.
reviews.title: An enjoyable stay in Vernazza

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2004, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Camere Elisabetta remains one of the highlights of our visit to the Cinque Terre...when every postcard photo of Vernazza features 'our' rooftop deck where we enjoyed pre dinner wine, picnic dinners and romantic sunsets...how can you complain about climbing a multitude of stairs and living like a local for a few days?
reviews.title: Authentic Cinque Terre lodging

likes.liked: — It was an authentic lodging experience-not a sterile American hotel with room service style of lodging
likes.disliked: — The train noise was frightening the first night-but it was also part of the experience.

reviews.title: Loved our "room with a view" in Vernazza
reviews.text: The train screaming out of the tunnel at 11 pm was slightly disconcerting compounded with jet lag...but if the residents can adjust, so can we. I long for the clanging of the church bells calling us to a new day...Vernazza is a magical place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved the location, the views, the unexpected bonus of a deck to use as our living room-all was wonderful.
reviews.title: A bit dodgy, but turned out great!

reviews.text: I'd recommend this location to adventurous, flexible visitors who are open to new experiences and unexpected delights.
reviews.title: Second Time in Vernazza was even better!

reviews.text: We loved our room. It took a hike up to reach it, but the panoramic view of the ocean and terraced hills was spectacular and certainly worth the effort. Our room was clean and modern with a comfortable queen sized bed and a private bathroom with a shower, lots of hot water and lots of storage space. We only talked to Elisabetta on the phone, but we did meet her husband who is extremely charming and really made us feel welcome. The spectacular view from the roof terrace with its comfortable lounges, chairs and tables enouraged us to hike up and down to buy breakfast and dinner and eat in one of the most beautiful settings in Vernazza. There were also lots of clothes lines to catch up with laundry chores for those who had been travelling for awhile. All this for 62 Euros a night. Heaven-sent for a retired couple in their 70's who do not mind a climb through the narrow, picturesque cobble-stone stairs of Vernazza.
reviews.title: What a view and what a deal!!!!! A GEM!!!
